attributes.additional_details:
We petition that only those  who are British Nationals and  taxpayers be eligible to vote wherever they may reside.
At Local Government level all those who pay rates/council tax are eligible to vote for who administrate same-democracy in action.
At Government level all resident nationals get a vote whether they pay tax or not.
The last labour government denied all those Brits overseas a vote and whilst they said that they don’t contribute anything which is untrue because many pay tax, promote trade on which the British economy was built. There were those that thought it was because most ex-pats were Conservatives numbering around 8,000000.Conversely, the same government supported the unemployed voter.
With the exception of the disabled and elderly to be democratic only tax payers should have a vote.
It is hoped that there are proper facilities at the next election – the same parliament would have condemned any election in the third world without adequate facilities.
